Judul: STUDY OF ELECTROMAGNETIC WAVES SCATTERING ON GOLD NANOSPHERES USING  DISCRETE  DIPOLE  APPROXIMATION METHOD
Abstrak: In this thesis, we report the scattering phenomenon of single and double gold nanospheres. The scattering eciencies are calculated in the visible region using discrete dipole approximation. Checking for the convergence is limited by the com puting facility and the acceptable number of cells is 11536. The computed resultst well with analytical Mie theory. The scattering eciencies are red-shifted and  has higher peak for larger nanospheres. We also include the scattering calculation for two separated spheres and it showed strong eld enhancement. The results for Si(dielectric) nanospheres are included as a comparison.
